  "Allegations" : "THIS COMPLAINT WAS INITIATED AFTER THE CUSTOMER READ A NEWSPAPER ARTICLE ABOUT INAPPROPRIATE SALES OF VARIABLE ANNUNITIES TO THE ELDERY.  PEOPLE'S SECURITIES RECEIVED THIS COMPLAINT FROM THE HARTFORD ON MAY 21, 2003 IN RESPONSE TO A REQUEST FROM THE CT DEPT. OF INSURANCE.  IN HER COMPLAINT, SHE REQUESTED A REFUND ON THE $150,929 VARIABLE ANNUITY PURCHASED IN JULY, 1999 BECAUSE THE CUSTOMER CLAIMED THAT THE INVESTMENT WAS UNSUITABLE, AND HAD SINCE LOST VALUE.  IT HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED THAT A VIOLATION OCCURRED, NOR DOES PEOPLE'S SECURITIES BELIEVE THAT THE COMPLAINT HAS MERIT.  THIS COMPLAINT IS CLOSED AT THE HARTFORD, WHICH HAS NOT RECEIVED A FOLLOW-UP REQUEST FROM THE CT DEPT. OF INSURANCE.  NEITHER THE HARTFORD NOR PEOPLE'S SECURITIES HAS MADE A MONETARY SETTLEMENT WITH THE CUSTOMER.  TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, THE CUSTOMER HAS NOT PURSUED THIS MATTER ANY FURTHER.
